channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Train Cruise
channel.desc: In 1945 at the end of WWII, an atomic bomb hit Nagasaki. We enjoy the stunning scenery, but more importantly we talk with those who survived and remember those who lost their lives.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Nhk Newsline
channel.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: My Street Piano
channel.desc: On a shopping street in front of Kagoshima Chuo Station sits Japan' s original street piano, which passersby love to visit and play from the heart.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Budo Secrets
channel.desc: Karate, Taekwondo, Capoeira."Kicks"have evolved in different ways worldwide. Now, an Okinawan Karate master and a Muay Thai champion explore its cutting edge.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Design Museum Japan
channel.desc: Miyanaga Aiko (Contemporary artist) visits Kyoto. The Mincho font, drawn by hand in around 1990, evokes 350-year-old hand-carved woodblocks, made to print Buddhist sutras.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Kamikaze: An Untold History Part1
channel.desc: "Kamikaze," explosive-laden ramming attacks, were carried out during World War 2, sacrificing 4,000 lives. Why did the Japanese push forward with this method? We uncover the truth about the kamikaze.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Nhk Newsline
channel.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Time Lapse Journey
channel.desc: Journey to the great northern land of Japan: Hokkaido. Its scenery changes dramatically throughout the year. Witness the beauty of Hokkaido through time-lapse photography.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Darwin's Amazing Animals
channel.desc: Cute, round-eyed Sengis live in the African savannah. They build complex trails where they raise their young. When threatened, they take off at full speed. This episode looks at their amazing lives.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Viewpoint Science
channel.desc: The proactive science education program which encourages primary and lower secondary school children to discover and investigate the mysteries which puzzle them.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Nhk Newsline
channel.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

channel.name: NHK World JP
channel.title: Japanology Plus Mini
channel.desc: Japanology Plus explores Japanese life and culture. In this 5-minute digest, we look at tatami mats: a quintessentially Japanese flooring material.

channel.desc: Karate, Taekwondo, Capoeira."Kicks"have evolved in different ways worldwide. Now, an Okinawan Karate master and a Muay Thai champion explore its cutting edge.
